document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Oriental species of Apsilocera Bouček (Hymenoptera, Pteromalidae), with description of twelve new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Oriental species of Apsilocera Bouček (Hymenoptera, Pteromalidae), with description of twelve new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to females of Oriental species of
Apsilocera

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Vertex with various ornamentations distinctly raised above regular sculpture (
Figs 19–22
,
25, 26, 28 , 30–32
); mandible sometimes with distal tooth blunt (
Figs 20
,
25, 26
)............................................................... 2

– Vertex with only regular sculpture (
Figs 23, 24
,
27, 29
); mandible always with distal tooth sharp (
Figs 23
,
27, 29
)......... 9

2 ( 1 ) Fore wing with distinct brownish cloud below marginal vein (
Figs 7
, 33 ); head with a crest between each eye and corresponding torulus; antennae inserted very high, almost on vertex; clypeal margin with one small blunt tooth (
Fig. 25
); clava pale yellow (
Fig. 7
); distal tooth of mandible blunt (
Fig. 25
)...................
A. fulvipennis Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Fore wing hyaline (
Figs 1–6
,
8– 12
); head sometimes with other types of ornamentation; other characters not in above combination............................................................................................... 3

3 ( 2 ) Vertex with only one tooth between eye and corresponding ocellus; clypeal margin slightly emarginate; distal tooth of mandible sharp (
Figs 3
, 21 ,
31
)............................................
A. cornuta Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Vertex with other types of ornamentation, if with one strong tooth than this followed by several smaller ones (
Figs 22
, 30 ,
32
); clypeus sometimes different; distal tooth of mandible blunt or sharp............................................. 4

4 ( 3 ) Vertex with a row of teeth originating near eye and ending near posterior ocellus (
Figs 22
, 30 ,
32
)...................... 5

– Vertex with one or two crests or elevations between posterior ocelli and anterior ocellus (
Figs 19, 20
,
26, 28
)............. 6

5 ( 4 ) Vertex high, in anterior view distinctly arched between posterior ocelli; head in anterior view only slightly transverse, about 1.2× as broad as high; tooth near eye distinctly larger than the rest; clypeal margin slightly emarginate; distal tooth of mandible rounded (
Fig. 22
)..................................................
A. dentata Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Vertex normal, not high, in anterior view not distinctly arched between posterior ocelli; head in anterior view very transverse, about 1.6× as broad as high; tooth near eye not or only slightly larger than the rest; clypeal margin with small median projection; distal tooth of mandible sharp (
Figs 30
, 32 ).....................
A. tuberculata Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

6 ( 4 ) Vertex with one continuous crest composed of small sharp teeth, leaving no depression in middle; clypeal margin protruding and slightly emarginate; clava uniformly brownish; distal tooth of mandible blunt (
Fig. 19
).........................................................................................
A. acuticristata Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Vertex with two distinct crests not composed of small sharp teeth, leaving a depression in middle; clypeal margin protruding but straight; clava sometimes different; distal tooth of mandible blunt (
Figs 20
, 26 ) or sharp.......................... 7

– Funicular segments shorter, with only one row of sensilla each (
Figs 10
, 28 ); gena long (
Fig. 28
); vertex less high (
Fig. 28
); distal tooth of mandible sharp; hind coxa almost entirely dark dorsally; only hind femur slightly dark (
Fig. 10
).......................................................................
A. obtusicristata Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

9 ( 1 ) Hind coxa mostly dark (
Fig. 11
); clava, especially the last two segments, yellowish, distinctly paler than rest of flagellum (
Figs 11
, 29 ); gena hollowed at mouth corner, clypeus emarginate, with one conspicuous projection on each side (
Fig. 29
)......................................................................
A. palliclava Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Hind coxa pale, with only a dark basal spot; flagellum of uniform colour (
Figs 5, 6
,
9
); gena and clypeus different........ 10

10 ( 9 ) Vein M about 1.5× as long as vein S; malar space about 1 / 4 eye height; clypeal margin medially emarginate.............................................................................................
A. brevivena Xiao & Huang

– Vein M at least twice as long as vein S (
Figs 5, 6
,
9
); malar space longer (
Figs 23, 24
,
27
); clypeal margin usually different. 11

11 ( 10 ) Gena only slightly receding towards mouth; clypeal margin broadly angulate (
Fig. 24
); stigma elongated, lower margin emarginate (
Fig. 6
)...................................................
A. elongata Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Gena strongly receding towards mouth; clypeal margin with one or two small teeth (
Figs 23
, 27 ); stigma not elongated, lower margin not emarginate (
Figs 5
, 9 )........................................................................ 12

12 ( 11 ) Clypeus with one small tooth; mandible formula 3 : 4 (
Fig. 27
); metasoma dorsally with large pale spot at base (
Fig. 9
).....................................................................
A. maculata Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.

– Clypeus with two small teeth; mandible formula 4 : 4 (
Fig. 23
); metasoma dorsally without large pale spot at base (
Fig. 5
).................................................................... ..
A. dupla Mitroiu
& van Achterberg, sp. n.
